title: Theses
blurb: McGill's Living Lab : A database of sustainability-focused Applied Student Research (ASR) projects,The Living Lab is a digital repository of applied research that creates a culture of sustainability on McGill campus. The database aims to help McGill and the broader community access, learn from, and build upon sustainability-focused projects.

title: Undergraduate Reports
blurb: Contains all theses and dissertations completed at McGill. This wording will need massaging for public use, this is just what Robin wrote as placeholder.

title: Articles (pre/post prints)
blurb: Faculty publications include articles, conference papers, books and working papers by members of the McGill academic community.

title: Presentations
blurb: Research projects coming from a course-based graduate degree. NB. Civil and Mechanical Engineering reports are not full-text searchable.

title: Posters
blurb: Undergraduate research contains undergraduate Bioresource Engineering project reports, Honours theses, and Faculty-sponsored papers. Honours undergraduate theses may be included in eScholarship if sponsored by a faculty member. Faculty-sponsored papers are exemplary examples of undergraduate scholarship. Faculty members wishing to sponsor an honours thesis or a paper for deposit should contact escholarship.library@mcgill.ca
